intro: Taeniophyllum singulare, commonly known as the single-leaf spurge, is a rare and unique flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Southeast Asia. It is characterized by its singular, elongated leaf that often exceeds the length of its stem, giving it a distinctive appearance. The plant produces small, inconspicuous yellow flowers that bloom in late spring or early summer. It thrives in shaded, moist environments and is often found in forest understories. Due to its limited distribution and specific habitat requirements, Taeniophyllum singulare is considered a rare and endangered species.
